channel.title: Bloomberg Technology
channel.copyright: Copyright 2025 BLOOMBERG L.P. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED

item.title: China on Cusp of Seeing Over 100 DeepSeeks, Ex-Top Official Says
item.description: China’s advantages in developing artificial intelligence are about to unleash a wave of innovation that will generate more than 100 DeepSeek-like breakthroughs in the coming 18 months, according to a former top official.
item.dc:creator: Lucille Liu

item.title: Alphabet Lacks Tesla’s Stock Buzz in Race For Driverless Rides
item.description: There’s a lot of investor excitement about driverless cars, yet Alphabet Inc.’s shares reflect little of that euphoria — even as its Waymo robotaxis proliferate in major US cities.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Vlastelica

media:content.media:description: A Waymo autonomous taxi, left, and a vehicle Tesla is using for robotaxi testing purposes in Austin, Texas, US, on Friday, June 20, 2025. Elon Musk said Tesla Inc. has set June 22 as a tentative launch date for the start of its robotaxi network.

item.title: Saudi Tech Firm Ejada to Reapply for IPO After Approval Expires
item.description: Saudi Arabian technology services company Ejada Systems Ltd. is planning to reapply with kingdom’s regulator for its initial public offering, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Laura Gardner Cuesta, Christine Burke

media:content.media:description: The Saudi Stock Exchange in Riyadh. Photographer: Mohammed Almuaalemi/Bloomberg

item.title: Google Faces UK Pressure Over AI Search Summary, Advertising
item.description: Alphabet Inc.’s Google is set to face more scrutiny from the UK’s antitrust watchdog over its online search and advertising business.
item.dc:creator: Upmanyu Trivedi

media:content.media:description: The Google headquarters in Mountain View, California, US. Photographer David Paul Morris/Bloomberg

item.title: VC Firm Project A Raises €325 Million Fund for European Startups
item.description: Project A, a German venture capital firm that has placed early bets on defense startups, raised a €325 million ($373 million) fund to back European companies.
item.dc:creator: Christina Kyriasoglou

media:content.media:description: Partner and managing director for UK, Project A Malin Posern

item.title: JPMorgan Sees Asian Tech Stocks Gaining Another 15-20% This Year
item.description: Asian technology stocks may rally another 15%-20% this year, driven mainly by the strong momentum in the artificial intelligence space, according to JPMorgan Chase & Co.
item.dc:creator: Jeanny Yu

item.title: YouTube Exemption From Australian Teen Social Media Ban Opposed by Regulator
item.description: Australia’s online regulator called on the government to reverse its controversial exemption for YouTube from a social media ban for under-16s, an unusual intervention that echoes similar pleas from rival platforms including Facebook and TikTok.
item.dc:creator: Angus Whitley

media:content.media:description: Photo by JOSH EDELSON/AFP via Getty Images) Photographer: JOSH EDELSON/AFP

item.title: Jensen Huang Starts Selling Nvidia Stock Under $865 Million Plan
item.description: Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang has started selling the chipmaker’s stock, his first transactions under a plan that allows him to offload up to $865 million worth by year’s end.
item.dc:creator: Biz Carson

media:content.media:description: Jensen Huang Photographer: Annabelle Chih/Bloomberg

item.title: Chinese Investors Trim Exposure to Tencent After April Peak
item.description: Chinese investors have steadily reduced their exposure to Tencent Holdings Ltd. over the past two months as the tech giant struggles to maintain market enthusiasm.
item.dc:creator: April Ma

item.title: Samsung Is Poised to Unveil Latest Folding Smartphones on July 9
item.description: Company announces will introduce new Galaxy devices and AI features at Unpacked summer event
item.dc:creator: Chris Welch

media:content.media:description: A Samsung Electronics Co. Galaxy Z Fold 6 smartphone displayed at a Samsung store in Seoul, South Korea, on Friday, Oct. 4, 2024. Samsung is expected to report record-high revenue in the September quarter, buoyed by a recovery in chip prices and strong demand for AI-supporting high-bandwidth memory.

item.title: Tesla Shares Jump Most in Two Months on Robotaxi Rollout
item.description: Tesla Inc. shares climbed after the automaker rolled out its long-promised driverless taxi service to a handful of riders, a modest debut for what Elon Musk sees as a transformative new business line.
item.dc:creator: Kara Carlson

media:content.media:description: A Tesla robotaxi vehicle in Austin on June 22.

item.title: Defense Tech Sector Reacts to US-Iran Strike | Bloomberg Tech 6/23/2025
item.description: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde discusses the US strike on Iranian nuclear sites and the market impact. Plus, defense tech investors look for startups addressing asymmetric threats. And Tesla’s robotaxi service gets underway with a modest launch. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Meta Held Deal Talks With Startup Runway in AI Recruiting Push
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc. Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg discussed a possible acquisition with video startup Runway AI Inc., as part of his deal-making drive in artificial intelligence.
item.dc:creator: Anne VanderMey, Sarah Frier

media:content.media:description: The Runway AI logo on a smartphone arranged in New York.

item.title: House Bans WhatsApp From Staffers’ Government-Issued Devices
item.description: Meta’s WhatsApp messaging platform has been added to a list of apps banned from government-issued devices for congressional staffers in the US House of Representatives, a move driven by concerns about the app’s data security.
item.dc:creator: Kurt Wagner

media:content.media:description: The Facebook Inc. WhatsApp logo on a smartphone arranged in the Brooklyn Borough of New York, U.S., on Tuesday, Oct. 5, 2021. Signal and Telegram, two private messenger apps, saw downloads and user sign-ups soar during the extended downtime of Facebook Inc.’s network of apps and services.

item.title: VSCO Debuts Standalone iPhone Camera App With Popular Photo Filters
item.description: Capture joins a growing group of apps positioned as alternatives to Apple’s iPhone camera software.
item.dc:creator: Chris Welch

media:content.media:description: VSCO’s Capture app will debut in a handful of test markets this week.

item.title: Murati’s Thinking Machines Raises Cash at $10 Billion Valuation
item.description: Andreessen Horowitz, Accel and Conviction Partners have invested in the former OpenAI executive’s startup.
item.dc:creator: Kate Clark

media:content.media:description: Mira Murati, chief technology officer of OpenAI Inc., during an interview on "The Circuit with Emily Chang" in San Francisco, California, US, on Monday, April 4, 2023. Murati discussed the potential for artificial intelligence to improve things like education and productivity.

item.title: Super Micro Seeks $2 Billion Convertible Bond as Deals Ramp Up
item.description: Super Micro Computer Inc. is raising $2 billion from the sale of convertible bonds, extending a dramatic run of companies tapping the resurgent market to secure cheap capital.
item.dc:creator: Yiqin Shen, Anthony Hughes

media:content.media:description: The Super Micro Computer Inc. headquarters in San Jose, California.

item.title: CityFibre Set to Secure Close to £2 Billion for Fiber Rollout
item.description: CityFibre is nearing an agreement for about £2 billion ($2.7 billion) in fresh capital in a round that will help the fiber company continue operating and expand its reach, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Jillian Deutsch

item.title: Tesla Rolls Out Robotaxi in Austin to Handful of Users
item.description: Tesla Inc. rolled out its long-awaited robotaxi service to a handful of users following almost a decade of hype from Elon Musk, kicking off a precarious new era for the carmaker. Some online influencers were invited to take a ride. A human "safety monitor" rode in the front passenger seat. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Wolfspeed Plans Bankruptcy After Clinching Deal With Creditors
item.description: Wolfspeed Inc. is planning to file for bankruptcy by July 1 with a deal to slash its debt by about $4.6 billion and hand over control to convertible noteholders.
item.dc:creator: Georgia Hall, Jonathan Randles, Steven Church

media:content.media:description: A Wolfspeed wafer Photographer: Boris Roessler/picture alliance/Getty Images

item.title: Robo-adviser Wealthfront Files Confidentially for an IPO
item.description: The robo-advisory firm Wealthfront filed confidentially for a US initial public offering, a signal that more financial-technology firms are set to go public after a protracted lull.
item.dc:creator: Paige Smith

item.title: Strategy Makes Second-Smallest Bitcoin Purchase Since November
item.description: Strategy bought $26 million of Bitcoin over the past seven days, the second-smallest weekly acquisition announced by the Michael Saylor-led digital-asset treasury company since he ramped up its cryptocurrency purchases more than six months ago.
item.dc:creator: Kirk Ogunrinde

media:content.media:description: Co-founder and executive chairman of Strategy Michael Saylor

item.title: Military Satellite Maker Iceye Explores IPO as Sales on Track to Double
item.description: A Finnish satellite startup that’s benefiting from Europe’s military spending boom expects to double sales this year and is exploring an initial public offering.
item.dc:creator: Mark Bergen, Aaron Kirchfeld

media:content.media:description: An ICEYE SAR Satellite over the US.

item.title: Huawei’s New Laptop Adds to Evidence of Stalled Chip Advance
item.description: Huawei Technologies Co.’s latest computer product is powered by a chip manufactured using years-old technology, suggesting US sanctions are still preventing China from developing cutting-edge semiconductor technologies.
item.dc:creator: John Liu, Jessica Sui

media:content.media:description: The Huawei MateBook Fold

item.title: Hedge Fund Executives Eye $100 Million to Accumulate BNB Token
item.description: A team of crypto hedge fund executives are in advanced talks to raise $100 million for investing in a token linked to Binance Holdings Ltd. through a publicly listed company they control, in the latest spin on the Bitcoin treasury blueprint pioneered by Michael Saylor’s Strategy.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Weeks

item.title: US Braces for ‘Low-Level’ Cyberattacks by Iran After Airstrikes
item.description: US officials are warning businesses to brace for potential Iranian cyberattacks following American airstrikes on the country’s nuclear sites, an event that experts say could draw a relatively small response from hackers.
item.dc:creator: Patrick Howell O'Neill

media:content.media:description: Protesters demonstrate against US strikes on Iran, in Tehran, on June 22.

item.title: Apple Crashes Tech’s Formula One Party as Money Behind ‘F1’
item.description: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Austin Carr reports on the tech industry’s branding effort with Formula One racing, including Apple’s backing for a new movie to be released later this week.
item.dc:creator: Austin Carr

media:content.media:description: Racing scene from Apple Original Films’ “F1 The Movie.”

item.title: US Clean-Energy Project Cancellations Hit GOP Districts Hardest
item.description: Clean energy investments in the US are shrinking fast amid the rollback of tax incentives and policy uncertainties under President Donald Trump’s administration, with Republican districts hardest hit.
item.dc:creator: Tope Alake

media:content.media:description: Off-shore wind farm construction.

item.title: Sanhua Slips in Hong Kong Debut After $1.2 Billion Listing
item.description: Zhejiang Sanhua Intelligent Controls Co., the Chinese maker of fridge parts that’s working on becoming a cutting-edge robotics company, edged lower during its Hong Kong trading debut after its HK$9.3 billion ($1.2 billion) stock offering.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Zhu, Kelly Li, Jing Jin

media:content.media:description: A wine fridge stands inside the kitchen area of a microflat in Hong Kong, China, on Monday, May 13, 2019. Hong Kong property, with its sky-high prices, is beyond reach of many buyers. One solution of sorts: Build smaller apartments. Photographer: Justin Chin/Bloomberg

item.title: Prosus Reports First Profit Under CEO Bloisi’s New Strategy
item.description: Technology investor Prosus NV swung into profit for the first time, as it switches strategy under Chief Executive Officer Fabricio Bloisi.
item.dc:creator: Loni Prinsloo

media:content.media:description: Fabricio Bloisi, chief executive officer of Prosus NV, following a Bloomberg Television interview at the World Economic Forum (WEF) in Davos, Switzerland, on Thursday, Jan. 23, 2025. The annual Davos gathering of political leaders, top executives and celebrities runs from January 20 to 24.
